Create a regular tiling geometry

Source: R/geometries.R
geomTiles.Rd

Create a regular tiling geometry

geomTiles(window = NULL, cells = NULL, crs = NULL,
  tiling = "rectangular", centroids = FALSE)

Arguments

window

[data.frame(1)]
the origin (lower left corner) and the maximum value (upper right corner) of the tiling.
cells

[integerish(2)]
number of tiles in x and y dimension.
crs

[character(1)]
corrdinate reference system of the object in proj4 notation.
tiling

[character(1)]
pattern of the tiling. Possible options are "rectangular" (default), "hexagonal", "triangular".
centroids

[logical(1)]
should the centroids of the tiling be returned (TRUE) or should the tiling be returned (FALSE, default)?

Value

An invisible geom.

Examples

# create grid for GFC data
gfcWindow <- data.frame(x = c(-180, 180),
                        y = c(-60, 80))
tiles_gfc <- geomTiles(window = gfcWindow, cells = c(36, 14), crs = projs$longlat)

# create grid for MODIS data
modWindow <- data.frame(x = c(-20015109.354, 20015109.354),
                        y = c(-10007554.677, 10007554.677))
tiles_modis <- geomTiles(window = modWindow, cells = c(36, 18), crs = projs$sinu)

# create grid for the sentinel data
#sntWindow <- data.frame(x = c(),
#                        y = c())
#tiles_sentinel <- geomTiles(window = sntWindow, cells = c(), crs = projs$utm)
